column1: One of the Rainfall Rescue volunteers, Richard Meats, carried research on the MSLR rainfall gauges and noted that many of the gauges were associated with canals, that were owned by MSLR. Based on the dates of the readings he concluded that the Retford gauge was in all probability associated with the canal in Retford hence the location being adjacent to the Chesterfield Canal.

There is a note on the 1860s record sheet stating that the June 1865 reading and annual total are worng by 1 inch based on a comparison with readings in a newspaper; these records include this revised figure
